page.title: 02Tilwick Manor
page.content: To see Tilwick Manor you will have to walk along footpaths through open fields planted with wheat and rape. Sheltering on the edge of Tilwick Wood is the ruined Manor House. We do not know exactly how old it is, but it was definitely built before 1694. The walls are made of wattle and daub and through the ages they have been repaired with cement and bricks. The Manor House has a thatched roof with lots of black beams to support it. It has two red brick chimneys. One is enormous. Inside the house the floorboards are not very safe and the walls are crumbling. There are two very small outside doors. The house has not been occupied since the 1960's. Outside parts of the old moat can still be seen.
